main event: A ground-visual and radar observation of an unidentified flying object over Ogdensburg, New York on December 5-6, 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as round, small, and changing in brightness and color from bright green and blue to white and orange.
The object was observed for 10 to 25 minutes, rising and moving westward.
The object was tracked by radar at altitudes ranging from 19 to 24.3 degrees above the horizon.
The observer was a student, whose report was verified by a Coast Guard sailor on watch.
The intelligence officer concluded that the sighting was possibly an astronomical phenomenon.
sighted object: a round, small object that changed in brightness and color
witnesses: a student, verified by a Coast Guard sailor
